meanings.definition: A support or base for a structure, typically made of stone or wood.
meanings.sent1: The old barn stood tall on sturdy staddles.
meanings.sent2: The staddles held up the house during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel climbed the staddles to reach the roof.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was the staddles that supported her through tough times.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins revealed the remnants of stone staddles.

meanings.definition: To provide a stable foundation for a building or structure.
meanings.sent1: The builders carefully staddled the new shed in the backyard.
meanings.sent2: He staddles the fence posts to ensure they won't wobble.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to staddle the imaginary castle with toy blocks.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness staddles the community together like a strong pillar.
meanings.sent5: The roots of the tree staddle deep into the earth for support.

meanings.definition: A group of staddles used to elevate a structure above ground level.
meanings.sent1: The farmer arranged the staddle group to lift the shed off the wet ground.
meanings.sent2: The staddle formation created a unique look for the house.
meanings.sent3: The ducks waddled underneath the staddle cluster, seeking shelter.
meanings.sent4: The staddle assembly resembled a mini stonehenge in the field.
meanings.sent5: The staddle set-up prevented flooding in the barn during heavy rains.
